text: Palestinians faked a funeral ceremony for an individual supposedly killed by Israeli air strikes in Gaza
rating: These claims are misleading. We found the same video posted in March 2020 apparently showing a group of boys in Jordan.

text: Israel let "the al-Aqsa Mosque burn".
rating: The video is real, but additional footage from other angles makes it clear that a tree near to the mosque had caught fire, not the mosque itself.

text: Under a video showing rocket fire: "1/3 of these 250+ rockets fell inside the Gaza Strip, killing Palestinians"
rating: False. The video is old and the footage is from Syria, not Gaza.

text: Hamas moved truck-based missiles down a street in Gaza.
rating: The video is old. It was uploaded to Facebook on 25 November 2018, with a caption saying it was taken in the town of Abu Snan in Galilee, in Israel.

text: Posts from the Israel Defence Force twitter account said: "We just love killing" and "Just bombed some kids".
“Footage from Israeli helicopter shows the IDF killing many people at October 7 concert in Israel.”
The Israel Defense Forces confirmed it bombed a hospital in Gaza in a social media post written in Arabic.
Israel said that the deaths of seven aid workers from World Central Kitchen in the Gaza Strip Monday night were caused by a roadside bomb planted by Hamas.
Social media posts claiming to show recent Israeli attack on Lebanon.
Photo shows explosions from Russia’s 2022 invasion of Ukraine.
Image shows bombings near Beirut's international airport
A picture shows recent bombing in Beirut, Lebanon.
rating: Incorrect. The image is more than a year old and is of an Israeli airstrike on Gaza City.

text: Image shows explosions in the sky over Israel during Iran attack

Image of father carrying children in Gaza
A graph shows there were significantly fewer civilian deaths per airstrike in Gaza in 2023 than in previous conflicts in Syria and Iraq.
rating: This is misleading because the data used in the graph is not comparable. The charity behind some of the figures estimates the number of civilian deaths per injurious airstrike in Gaza in October 2023 was actually much closer to the rates quoted for other conflicts, though it’s unclear how reliable any such comparisons are.

This fact check was published Oct. 12, 2023. A week later on Thursday, Oct. 19, an airstrike toppled a wall at the Greek Orthodox Church of Saint Porphyrios causing serious damage and death. CLAIM
It's not true that "250 people were killed at a concert" in Israel Oct. 7.

multiple visuals claimed to be of Israel-Palestine war

A video shows a Palestinian “crisis actor” removing his bandages to show his worried mother that his injuries aren’t real.
Videos taken one day apart show a Palestinian “crisis actor” pretending to be seriously injured in a hospital bed one day and completely fine the next.
Israel staging a fake killing of a child by Hamas.
Video of a young actor being filmed lying in a pool of fake blood shows propaganda being created for use in the Israel-Hamas war.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) admitted on its Facebook account that it “decided to bomb” a hospital in Gaza.
rating: This is not a genuine IDF account and it has since been removed from Facebook. Israel denies responsibility for the hospital bombing.

rating: Photo is from other side of Gaza

text: A video shows the Israel Defense Forces using a mechanical tool to “bury terrorists in their tunnels”.
rating: The clip likely shows a tile lining of a chimney being removed, and pre-dates the current Israel-Gaza conflict.

text: The newest Israeli data on COVID-19 infections indicate a complete vaccine failure on every level. The data from Israel shows that nearly all serious cases and deaths are among the vaccinated.

Videos show a Palestinian ‘crisis actor’ in critical condition in hospital one day but perfectly fine the next.
rating: False. The videos feature two different men and were filmed months apart.

text: A video shows “Israeli bulldozers” running over civilians outside the Kamal Adwan hospital in north Gaza.
rating: This footage is unrelated to the Israel-Gaza conflict. It shows the dispersal of protesters by the Egyptian military in Cairo in 2013.

text: A video shared online in early May 2024 shows Gazans filming fake hospital footage to win sympathy for the Palestinian cause.
Video shows a fake funeral in Gaza in 2021.

A video shows Hamas fighters praying after the recent ceasefire deal in Gaza was announced.
rating: The video being shared is more than 17 years old, and unrelated to the recent announcement.
